wikitext.*:
'''Gelmir''' can refer to: 
== Elves of the First Age ==
Two [[Elves]], who lived during the [[First Age]]:
* [[Gelmir (son of Guilin)]], son of [[Guilin]] who was captured by [[Morgoth]]'s servants in the [[Dagor Bragollach]].
* [[Gelmir (messenger of Círdan)]], a [[Noldor]]in [[Elves|Elf]] sent by [[Círdan]] as a messenger to [[Nargothrond]].

== Earlier writings ==
Other characters who were named ''Gelmir'' in earlier writings:
* [[Finwë]], father of [[Fingolfin]], who was named ''Gelmir'' in ''[[The Lay of the Fall of Gondolin]]'' and in one of the [[Prose Fragments Following the Lost Tales]].
* [[Gelmir (son of Golfinweg)]], a king of the [[Gnomes]] in the ''[[Index of Names for The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]''.
